body_html:
I just try the code both in linux and windows.The result is :linux users do not need to change anything,but if you use windows , you need to modify what i have been mentioned:

in linux:
`

os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed')
'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'
os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed')
'/tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'

`

in windows:
`

os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_
connected_feed')
'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'
os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_c
onnected_feed')
'/tmp\tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'

`

body:
I just try the code both in linux and windows.The result is :linux users do not need to change anything,but if you use windows , you need to modify what i have been mentioned:

in linux:
`
>>>os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed')
'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'
>>> os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed')
'/tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'

`

in windows:
`
>>> os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_
connected_feed')
'/tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'
>>> os.path.join(os.getenv('TEST_TMPDIR', '/tmp'),'tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_c
onnected_feed')
'/tmp\\tensorflow/mnist/logs/fully_connected_feed'

`
